title: Triangulation error
body:
**Linux- Ubuntu 16.04.6 LTS with Anaconda Env and DeepLabCut version 2.1.6.2**

Please complete the following information about your system:

OS: Linux
DeepLabCut Version 2.1.6.2
Browser: chrome


**Describe the problem**

I am trying to follow the steps of "Demo 3D DeepLabCut" but when arriving to "Triangulation --> converting your 2D to 3D!" I run into the following error:
```

Strange naming convention on your part. Respect.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
UnboundLocalError                         Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-15-ce605166a4d2> in <module>
      4 video_path = '/home/dlc/Desktop/DeepLabCut-master/examples/videos-raw/'
      5 
----> 6 deeplabcut.triangulate('/home/dlc/Desktop/DeepLabCut-master/examples/testing2-Paula-2020-03-20-3d/config.yaml',video_path, videotype='mp4')

~/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/deeplabcut/pose_estimation_3d/triangulation.py in triangulate(config, video_path, videotype, filterpredictions, filtertype, gputouse, destfolder, save_as_csv)
     95     if isinstance(video_path, str)==True:
     96         flag=True
---> 97         video_list = auxiliaryfunctions_3d.get_camerawise_videos(video_path,cam_names,videotype=videotype)
     98     else:
     99         video_list = video_path

~/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/deeplabcut/utils/auxiliaryfunctions_3d.py in get_camerawise_videos(path, cam_names, videotype)
    131                     putativecam2name=os.path.join(path,pref+cam_names[1]+suf+ending)
    132             #print([os.path.join(path,pref+cam+suf+ending),putativecam2name])
--> 133             if os.path.isfile(putativecam2name):
    134                 #found a pair!!!
    135                 video_list.append([os.path.join(path,pref+cam+suf+ending),putativecam2name])

UnboundLocalError: local variable 'putativecam2name' referenced before assignment

```
**How to Reproduce the problem**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1.I have named my video files as camera-1 and camera-2. They are named the same in the config.yaml file of the 2D and 3D projects
2. Both 2D projects (one for camera-1 and the other for camera-2) have the same body parts and skeletons. These were copied and pasted into the 3D project config.yaml file.
3. the scorer 3D name was set to "DLC_3D" in the 3D config.yaml
4. Snapshots to use in the config.yaml files is set to -1
5. I now pass the config_path3d and the video_path (which is a path to a new folder where all the videos from two cameras are copied). 
6. The triangulation step (seen below) leads to the mentioned error (also see screenshot attached)

video_path = '/home/dlc/Desktop/DeepLabCut-master/examples/videos-raw/'

deeplabcut.triangulate('/home/dlc/Desktop/DeepLabCut-master/examples/testing2-Paula-2020-03-20-3d/config.yaml',video_path, videotype='mp4')



**Screenshots**
![Screenshot from 2020-03-24 13-46-27](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/56651907/77427037-ed01c800-6dd5-11ea-834e-b8562e1c800e.png)

**Additional context**
I am a beginner programmer. Thank you for your time!
